title: Echinochrome guarding effect against sodium arsenite-induced hepatorenal toxicity in rats.
abstract: The persistent and accumulative qualities of the poisonous metalloid arsenic make it a ubiquitous environmental threat. Echinochrome (Ech) is a natural product that possesses antioxidative, antiviral, antialgal, anti-allergic, and antibacterial effects.
journal: Journal of trace elements in medicine and biology : organ of the Society for Minerals and Trace Elements (GMS)
